
no need to use the full qualified name of the class. Use imports section instead

timeline.bodyHTML:
This check is not needed. We're inside the loop where changeManager.isCoordinator() is true

Suggested change
if (cacheManager.isCoordinator()) {
// address change we remove the nodes from the cache
membersLeft.forEach(node -> nodes.remove(node));
}
// address change we remove the nodes from the cache

replies.bodyText: this is a long story. infinispan cache are started on demand in wildfly so the only way to start them (because EAGER initilization in EAP is deprecated is referencing them in the ejb.
replies.author: elguardian

timeline.body:
`node.toString()` returns `Cluster Node [" +serverId "-" + location + "]` - so maybe it's clearer something like
```suggestion
        logger.info("Node left cluster {}, failing over and requeuing {}", node, Arrays.toString(jobs.toArray()));
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
node.toString() returns Cluster Node [" +serverId "-" + location + "] - so maybe it's clearer something like

Suggested change
logger.info("Node left in cluster {} node {}, failing over and requeuing {}", node.getServerId(), node, Arrays.toString(jobs.toArray()));
logger.info("Node left cluster {}, failing over and requeuing {}", node, Arrays.toString(jobs.toArray()));

timeline.body: currently we're only updating those members who left the cluster - but if I'm not wrong, this method may be called when new members joined the cluster also. Shouldn't we also add those in the cache?
